sentences.en: And in public appearances he does not even try to disguise his erudition.
sentences.cn: 在公开露面的场合,他也不刻意隐瞒他的博学多闻.

sentences.en: He fancied himself learned and assumed airs of erudition.
sentences.cn: 他自以为有学问,摆出—副博学的样子.

sentences.en: He is better qualified by his vast erudition for this teaching job.
sentences.cn: 他的博学使他更适合担任这项教学工作.

sentences.en: His erudition comes from his assiduous study.
sentences.cn: 他的博学来自他的刻苦钻研.

sentences.en: His erudition exasperated the average reader, and was sometimes queried by the expert.
sentences.cn: 他的博学使一般读者气结, 有时也被专家提出质疑.
他的学问显然博大精深。

sentences.en: I hadn't realized that there could be so much erudition about a matter like this.
sentences.cn: 我没想到这样一件事竟有这么大的学问.

sentences.en: The professor's erudition came from long years of study.
sentences.cn: 这位教授的学问来自长年累月的钻研.

sentences.en: The profound erudition of the writer came from long years of study.
sentences.cn: 这位作家渊博的学问来自长年累月的钻研.

sentences.en: The range of his erudition is wide.
They fancied themselves learned and assumed airs of erudition.
sentences.cn: 他们自以为有学问,摆出一副博学的样子.

sentences.en: To stimulate higher education with the students to become a complete human being with erudition.
sentences.cn: 藉由高等教育的刺激,培育学生拥有饱满学识的完整人格.
